programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc:
Journalist Nick Wallis joins police forces around the nation to discover how CCTV and technological advances are helping to bring criminals to justice. The programme reveals how essential surveillance cameras have become in the fight against crime and features footage of people caught red-handed
S02E01

programme.title: Motorway Cops: Catching Britain's Speeders
programme.desc:
Return of the programme following Cheshire Police's elite team of officers as they crack down on some of Britain's most serious driving offenders. PCs Ian Cosgrove and Rich Woodward attend the scene of a shocking multi-vehicle crash on the M56 that has left a woman trapped in a car, while Inspector Anton Sullivan enlists the help of PCs Niaz Waddington and Amy Hollis to pull a stolen car over. Nick Campbell narrates
S02E01

programme.title: Motorway Cops: Catching Britain's Speeders
programme.desc:
An urgent call leads to a multi-vehicle pursuit to rescue a child, as PC Ian Cosgrove tracks down the suspect on the M6 - but is the driver alone? In Cheshire, a vehicle with suspected links to organised crime has been seized and PC Amy Hollis is called in to escort it safely back to HQ., while in Ellesmere Port, PC Chris Swash is on the hunt for a car with cloned plates
S02E03

programme.title: Motorway Cops: Catching Britain's Speeders
programme.desc:
Inspector Anton Sullivan follows the dangerously erratic driver of a white van, but when he stops the vehicle the situation quickly escalates, forcing him to call for back-up. On the busy M56, PC Andy Doran spots a broken down lorry that's blocking a live lane, while Sgt Vicky Howell is in pursuit of a suspect vehicle travelling at speeds of 130mph. Nicky Campbell narrates
S02E04

programme.title: Motorway Cops: Catching Britain's Speeders
programme.desc:
A Tactical Pursuit and Containment (TPAC) operation is in full swing as a vehicle linked to drug dealing is on the run and evading police. As the suspects hit heavy traffic, the team is presented with a perfect window to stop them. PC Rich Woodward tracks down two men who were involved in the assault of a police officer and then ran away and chases them on foot through a field
S02E05

programme.title: Motorway Cops: Catching Britain's Speeders
programme.desc:
PC Matt Turner stops a vehicle with links to drug dealing in Macclesfield and a search of the vehicle reveals the driver definitely has something to hide. On the M6, PC Rich Woodward pursues a speeding vehicle and when he finally stops it, the occupants are unable to keep their story straight and questions are raised over the vehicle's insurance. Will Rich be able to uncover the truth?
S02E06

programme.title: Two Mules for Sister Sara (1970)
programme.desc: A grizzled drifter rescues a nun from a gang of rapists and gets roped into escorting her across the Mexican desert. He gradually realises there is more to his new companion than meets the eye - and she may be hiding a surprising secret. Don Siegel's Western, starring Clint Eastwood, Shirley MacLaine, Manolo Fabregas, Alberto Morin and John Kelly

programme.title: Bronco Billy (1980)
programme.desc: A modern-day cowboy travels across America with a Wild West show, but has trouble attracting an audience. Adding to his woes, he is joined by a spoiled heiress, who comes to like life on the road but also seems to attract bad luck. Comedy Western, directed by and starring Clint Eastwood. With Sondra Locke, Scatman Crothers, Sam Bottoms and Geoffrey Lewis

programme.title: Police Academy (1984)
programme.desc: An American police college lowers its entrance requirements in the hope of attracting new recruits, and in response, assorted dubious candidates turn up for enrolment. A short-tempered instructor is determined to weed out the bad apples, but a riot provides the clueless cops with a chance to prove their worth. Comedy, starring Steve Guttenberg, Kim Cattrall, Bubba Smith and GW Bailey

programme.desc: A forest ranger working on the border between the US and Canada has an encounter with an old enemy who has sworn revenge on him. However, the former foes are forced to work together to survive an encounter with a drug cartel's agents, who are searching for a missing shipment. Action adventure, starring Jean-Claude Van Damme, Tom Everett Scott and Orlando Jones

programme.title: North to Alaska (1960)
programme.desc: Gold prospector Sam travels to Seattle to fetch his partner George's fiancee. When he discovers she has married someone else, Sam takes it upon himself to find a suitable replacement. Unfortunately, his attempts to bring the substitute bride and George together do not go to plan, and a conman is trying to get his hands on their gold. Comedy Western, starring John Wayne, Stewart Granger, Capucine and Ernie Kovacs

programme.desc:

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
A special edition looking at the police dog teams in the Cleveland and Durham specialist operations unit. Cameras observe the highly trained animals and their handlers in training and in action as the documentary reveals the endearing bonds the hounds develop with their masters. Drawing on new stories as well as archive footage, this programme showcases the vital role the dog unit plays in collaring criminals within the region

programme.title: Police: Night Shift 999
programme.desc:
PCs Hayes and Fox are called to a suspected fight, but not all is at it seems and they end up trying to get to the bottom of an alleged drug deal gone wrong. Officers Wells and Bace deal with a lovers' spat spinning out of control and need to decide the best course of action to protect everyone, but it's not going to go down very well with either partner

programme.title: Police: Hour of Duty
programme.desc:
Officers attend a notorious pub where a man has been found with facial wounds following an assault, but none of the customers admit to having seen anything or want to talk about what happened, so CCTV footage is analysed to try to piece together the case. Meanwhile, police are dispatched by a call handler when a woman reports she is being threatened in her car by four men in balaclavas

programme.desc:
999: Criminals: Caught on Camera: Documentary in which journalist Nick Wallis joins police forces around the nation to discover how CCTV and technological advances are helping to bring criminals to justice. Here he exposes the rise in ram raids across the UK, with footage of two masked men using a 4x4 to pull the front off a cash machine at the University of East Anglia in Norwich. Nick also shows how detectives used laser-scanning technology to recreate a crime scene and close in on a gang that terrorised West Yorkshire pub owners in 2013

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera

programme.desc: 10/04/2023: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Gaby Roslin and Gethin Jones host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: The Moment of Proof
programme.desc:
A claw hammer containing the killer and victim's DNA is the key to cracking a murder. Plus, a burglar who photographs himself in the act leads police straight to his door
S03E11

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc:
Animal Park Summer: A hand-reared aardvark is reunited with her family for the first time since birth, but keepers are not sure whether she will be welcomed or perceived as a threat
S2021E11

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc:
Martin Roberts heads to Suffolk, where he finds himself charmed by a two-bed mid-terrace that has remained largely untouched over the years. He is less enthusiastic about a two-bed semi in Bedfordshire, however, in which he discovers several worrying cracks in the walls. Meanwhile, Dion Dublin is off barnstorming in Kent to look at the development potential of an enormous plot of land
S24E50

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc:
Oswestry 11: Charlie Ross presents the show from Oswestry in Shropshire, and visits a firm that makes wooden standing frames for people with spinal injuries. With Charles Hanson and Ben Cooper
S64E12

programme.title: BBC News at One
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Look East
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc:
The fraudsters taking out expensive phone contracts and leaving others to foot the bill, and how Companies House is being abused by criminals - to legitimise their wrongdoing leaving innocent people to deal with the fallout. And there's plenty more advice and tips along the way. Presented by Angela Rippon, Gloria Hunniford and Julia Somerville
S14E14

programme.title: Virtually Home
programme.desc:
A mother and daughter in Surrey call on the help of interior designer Kunal Trehan and the virtual reality design studio for advice on what to do with their dark and dingy hallway
S01E06

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc:
Welsh Marches: Sonali Shah is in the Welsh Marches with a couple who want to find a new home with enough land to be self-sufficient. They also visit a community gardening project
S22E17

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc:
Nigel Havers hosts as five dealers battle each other to buy items brought in by the public including a pottery wheel, a transforming tea stand and a set of port hole mirrors
S04E15

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc:
Over three rounds, contestants vie to find the single 'unbeatable' answer and streak ahead of the rest to make the final where they can win a cash prize. General knowledge quiz, hosted by Jason Manford
S03E06

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc:
Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Hosted by Alexander Armstrong and Ed Gamble
S29E06

programme.title: The Boy, the Mole, the Fox and the Horse
programme.desc: Animated adaptation of Charlie Mackesy's popular illustrated book about a boy and his animal companions, who share a series of brief but profound conversations on the nature of friendship as they journey together in the youngster's search for home. With the voices of Tom Hollander, Idris Elba, Gabriel Byrne and newcomer Jude Coward Nicoll

programme.title: BBC News at Six
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Look East
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: 10/04/2023: The first visit of the week to the One Show studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat. Presented by Alex Jones and Emma Willis

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Lily is nervous ahead of her 20 week scan and Ricky is panicking about being a dad. Kim begs Howie for forgiveness but he won't listen. Suki and Eve return from their business trip and Vinny gets Eve involved in planning a surprise party for Nish

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc:
John Torode and Gregg Wallace present the audition round of this year's cookery competition. The nine contestants must each prepare a Family Favourite dish, which John and Gregg will sample in a special tasting room - with no clue which cook prepared which meal. After they have chosen their three favourites to fast-track to the next round, the remaining contestants will be set an invention test
S19E01

programme.title: Blue Lights
programme.desc:
The Fear: Grace Ellis investigates the punishment shooting of a young McIntyre drug runner, and her old skills as a social worker help get the evidence she needs to bring charges against the gang. However, she is stalled by a senior colleague, who makes it clear that she should back off. When Gordy pulls away from Angela, she becomes desperate for help
S01E03

programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: Project Icon: The UK's Next Music Star
programme.desc:
The judges test the contestants' commercial potential in song production, with the six singers paired up and challenged to rework and remix their partner's signature track. Once they've finished in the studio, they will then have to showcase their reworked song live in front of their rivals and the judges, before one pair are challenged to perform against each other to stay in the contest
S01E03

programme.title: Charlotte in Sunderland
programme.desc:
Charlotte and Jake organise the biggest gender reveal party the north-east has ever seen but nerves set in as Charlotte is behind schedule leaving Jake alone to entertain the guests. As Letitia's shock diagnosis starts to sink in, Charlotte and her mum have an emotional heart to heart
S01E05

programme.title: Charlotte in Sunderland
programme.desc:
Charlotte and her mum argue as they get to grips with the diagnosis but all is forgiven when they go wig shopping in London after Letitia's first treatment. At Crosby Manor, the builders are in to start planning the new nursery and Charlotte faces the fact her mum might not be at the birth
S01E06

programme.title: Anton & Giovanni's Adventures in Sicily
programme.desc:
The pair make their way through the centre of the island in the final leg of their trip where they try their hands at pasta-making and synchronised swimming before heading to the outskirts of Palermo where Giovanni has lined up an overnight stay with a group of beer-brewing monks. Finally, they head into Palermo where Anton meets Giovanni's parents and unveils a surprise birthday present
S01E03

Krishna from Hertfordshire is hoping that Will Kirk can repair the swinging bench that has been in her family for over 120 years and Maria brings in a ceramic sculpture made by her mother that is in desperate need of repair

programme.desc:
The teams set off for checkpoint four - the remote outpost of Churchill that is only accessible by a twice-weekly train and where polar bears can outnumber people. One team make their first major mistake of the race trying to get to Calgary - they'll need to make a race-changing decision to get to the train in time. Another pair encounter a family of missionaries who make them question their reasons for running the race. And one contestant gets more than they bargained for when a bear blocks their path to the train, putting their race in jeopardy

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc:
Gordon invites his 11 contenders to Anglesey, north Wales, to test their raw skills and pure talent. After an expert masterclass on seaweed, the teams must precisely identify and harvest samples of the sustainable crop. Up against the tides, they need to traverse the rocks, to prove they can follow instructions. Next, Gordon tests the contenders' ability to run a business in Wales' glorious 'Little Italy' by the sea, Portmeirion. He asks the teams to create and sell pizzas to locals and tourists - whichever team takes the most money wins. Finally, it's crunch-time as the contenders come face to face with the acerbic chef

Vegan handbags with an X-rated twist raise eyebrows in the Den, the creators of a new home delivery app for shoppers strive to bag a deal and a Lancashire couple behind a range of homemade soups and stews try to warm hearts as well as stomachs. He next sets out to discover who knows the fitness food market, tasking them to master product development, marketing and design. They then face a relentless Q&A from industry greats, including Olympic champion boxer Nicola Adams. Finally, it's the biggest test of all, as Gordon himself grills the contenders on their performance

Next, Gordon tests the contenders' ability to run a business in Wales' glorious 'Little Italy' by the sea, Portmeirion. He asks the teams to create and sell pizzas to locals and tourists - whichever team takes the most money wins. Finally, it's crunch-time as the contenders come face to face with the acerbic chef

Part one of two. The second year of a seven-year project to save the planet's endangered ecosystems. Chris Packham is in Greenland to learn more about the rate at which snow and ice are melting and retreating in the Arctic. programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams set off for checkpoint four - the remote outpost of Churchill that is only accessible by a twice-weekly train and where polar bears can outnumber people. One team make their first major mistake of the race trying to get to Calgary - they'll need to make a race-changing decision to get to the train in time. Another pair encounter a family of missionaries who make them question their reasons for running the race. And one contestant gets more than they bargained for when a bear blocks their path to the train, putting their race in jeopardy

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars

After an expert masterclass on seaweed, the teams must precisely identify and harvest samples of the sustainable crop. Up against the tides, they need to traverse the rocks, to prove they can follow instructions. Next, Gordon tests the contenders' ability to run a business in Wales' glorious 'Little Italy' by the sea, Portmeirion. He asks the teams to create and sell pizzas to locals and tourists - whichever team takes the most money wins. Finally, it's crunch-time as the contenders come face to face with the acerbic chef

Up against the tides, they need to traverse the rocks, to prove they can follow instructions. Next, Gordon tests the contenders' ability to run a business in Wales' glorious 'Little Italy' by the sea, Portmeirion. He asks the teams to create and sell pizzas to locals and tourists - whichever team takes the most money wins. Finally, it's crunch-time as the contenders come face to face with the acerbic chef

Next, Gordon tests the contenders' ability to run a business in Wales' glorious 'Little Italy' by the sea, Portmeirion. He asks the teams to create and sell pizzas to locals and tourists - whichever team takes the most money wins. Finally, it's crunch-time as the contenders come face to face with the acerbic chef

Chris Packham is in Greenland to learn more about the rate at which snow and ice are melting and retreating in the Arctic. Liz Bonnin returns to California to investigate surprising solutions for the state's wildfire season, and Steve Backshall travels to the Maldives, a country facing significant challenges because of climate change

He next sets out to discover who knows the fitness food market, tasking them to master product development, marketing and design. They then face a relentless Q&A from industry greats, including Olympic champion boxer Nicola Adams. Finally, it's the biggest test of all, as Gordon himself grills the contenders on their performance

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc:
Wild Britain: The team helps launch the Wild Britain campaign to protect the UK's wildlife. Ellie Harrison and Hamza Yassin join volunteers transforming an old playing field on the Lincolnshire Fens into a wildlife haven. John Craven heads to Chester Zoo, and Tom Heap looks at the UK's track record for protecting nature, and if a new bill currently going through parliament could undermine it. With special appearances from nature lovers Judi Dench and Deborah Meaden
S2023E16

programme.title: Our Changing Planet
programme.desc:
Part one of two. The second year of a seven-year project to save the planet's endangered ecosystems. Chris Packham is in Greenland to learn more about the rate at which snow and ice are melting and retreating in the Arctic. Liz Bonnin returns to California to investigate surprising solutions for the state's wildfire season, and Steve Backshall travels to the Maldives, a country facing significant challenges because of climate change

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow

Items brought in to be valued include a collection of football memorabilia, artwork and mountaineering equipment, and wooden figures depicting characters from The Wind in the Willows

programme.title: Global Questions
programme.desc: At Cop 27, Brazil's President Lula vowed to begin undoing the environmental destruction seen under former President Bolsonaro, as the new government works towards zero deforestation of the Amazon rainforest. He also said he would focus on the Yanomami indigenous crisis and appointed Brazil's first minister for indigenous peoples. Lyse Doucet travels to Rio de Janeiro, where she and her panel take questions from a local audience on what should be done to protect Brazil's natural resources

programme.title: BBC 100 Women In Conversation
programme.desc:
Priyanka Chopra Jonas: Priyanka Chopra Jonas never dreamt of becoming famous, but then she won the 2000 Miss World pageant, which provided a 'small-town girl' with a springboard for an international career. But she says she was getting paid 10% of her male co-actor's salary while starring in Bollywood movies, and it's been only during her most recent acting engagement in Hollywood that she has seen the gender pay gap closing for her. In an interview with BBC 100 Women's Yogita Limaye, the Indian actress and producer speaks about her experience with pay parity, body shaming and the pressure social media can bring.
S01E03

programme.title: Global Questions
programme.desc: At Cop 27, Brazil's President Lula vowed to begin undoing the environmental destruction seen under former President Bolsonaro, as the new government works towards zero deforestation of the Amazon rainforest. He also said he would focus on the Yanomami indigenous crisis and appointed Brazil's first minister for indigenous peoples. Lyse Doucet travels to Rio de Janeiro, where she and her panel take questions from a local audience on what should be done to protect Brazil's natural resources

programme.title: We Are England
programme.desc: Ruben and Lewis have dreamt of having a place on the Formula 1 circuit for as long as they can remember. Theyve been racing since the age of four and have won hundreds of trophies between them. This year, they are stepping up a gear and entering a race that could make or break their careers. Breaking into motorsports isn't easy. Motor racing is an exceptionally expensive sport, with annual costs in the tens of thousands just for go-karting for cars, the sky is the limit. It is also notably lacking in diversity. Those financial and cultural barriers often stand in the way of new drivers coming onto the track. But Ruben and Lewiss fathers are dedicated to helping their sons achieve their dreams. They, and their families, are prepared to sacrifice everything to help them make it. Now, they are stepping up from racing in go-karts to securing seats in professional race cars. Its time for Ruben and Lewis to deliver on track, get themselves noticed and do their dads proud. Can these dete

programme.title: BBC 100 Women In Conversation
programme.desc:
Priyanka Chopra Jonas: Priyanka Chopra Jonas never dreamt of becoming famous, but then she won the 2000 Miss World pageant, which provided a 'small-town girl' with a springboard for an international career. But she says she was getting paid 10% of her male co-actor's salary while starring in Bollywood movies, and it's been only during her most recent acting engagement in Hollywood that she has seen the gender pay gap closing for her. In an interview with BBC 100 Women's Yogita Limaye, the Indian actress and producer speaks about her experience with pay parity, body shaming and the pressure social media can bring.
S01E03

programme.desc: In-depth interviews with the world's leading politicians, opinion-formers and key figures from culture, business and sport.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: World Business Report
programme.desc: The latest business news with informed analysis from the world's financial centres.

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Bangkok to Hua Hin: Michael Portillo continues his exploration of Thailand, finding out about the lifesaving work of Bangkok's Queen Saovabha Memorial Institute and ending in the resort of Hua Hin
S01E06

programme.title: Canals: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc:
Geology: Liz McIvor discovers how carving up the landscape in order to build canals helped further man's understanding of the earth below. William Smith, a surveyor on the Somerset Coal Canal, discovered a way of ordering layers of rocks and eventually created the first geological map of England and Wales. His ideas about the age and formation of the earth were developed long before Darwin published his theories of evolution
S01E02

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc:
Alice Roberts visits the north of Britain to look at the most fascinating archaeology uncovered in the region over the course of 2021. In North Yorkshire, a team of community volunteers are digging down beneath Richmond Castle. On the northern tip of the Orkney Islands, the dig diary cameras are present to witness archaeologists racing to unearth rare discoveries from an endangered Neolithic tomb before it erodes into the sea. And 10 miles east of Edinburgh, volunteers are hunting for evidence of Scotland's oldest railway
S09E03

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: Hubble: The Wonders of Space Revealed: Since its launch in April 1990, the Hubble space telescope has made more than 1.5 million observations of the universe. One of the most productive scientific instruments in history, over the past three decades it has transformed man's view of the cosmos. This documentary tells the craft's remarkable story, drawing upon contributions by the astronauts who spacewalked on Hubble to carry out critical repairs and upgrades and the astronomers who have used its unique powers to make new discoveries about the universe

programme.title: The Sky at Night
programme.desc: Dr Maggie Aderin-Pocock presents the latest science in the hunt for exterrestrial life, visiting Professor Mark Sephton at Imperial College London - one of the scientists leading on the Perseverance Rover mission to Mars. Chris Lintott hears about the launch of a major European Space Agency mission to explore habitability on Jupiter's icy moons

programme.title: Endgame in Ireland
programme.desc:
Talking to Terrorists: An IRA mortar attack on 10 Downing Street in 1991, just months after John Major had taken office, apparently strengthened the British government's refusal to talk to terrorists. However, unbeknown to the public, a secret channel of communication was opened between the Irish republican movement and Her Majesty's Government. The former prime minister recalls this and the highly charged meetings that led to the Downing Street Declaration of December 1993
S01E02

programme.title: A Pembrokeshire Farm
programme.desc:
The house nears completion but Griff Rhys Jones faces some important decisions and last-minute disasters as he prepares to host a celebratory party - unsure of whether the construction will be finished by the time his guests arrive
S01E05

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: Vitamin Pills: Miracle or Myth?: The vitamin industry is worth more than 400million a year in the UK alone, but what are these pills actually doing for people's health? Dr Giles Yeo aims to find out, exploring if vitamin and mineral supplements are what they appear to be and putting people's diets to the test to find out if they really need these supplements. Those he meets include a scientist in Copenhagen, whose groundbreaking research into antioxidants indicates they may not have the extraordinary health-enhancing properties that people believe, and a nutrition scientist from the University of Greenwich, who tells Giles that on average most people in the UK are meeting their vitamin requirements thorough their diet

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc:
Blind Spots: Rachel finally comes face to face with Shaun, who offers up the location of the CIA safe house before managing to evade arrest once more. The fugitive soldier flees into an encounter with two mysterious strangers, who offer to provide him with the answers he is looking for. Rachel pays Napier a visit, and the meeting leaves her more convinced than ever that the CCTV network has been compromised
S01E04

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc:
A Pilgrim of Justice: The truth behind what happened to Shaun is revealed to him as he finally comes face to face with the powers behind his downfall. Rachel seeks answers of her own after her suspicions that Shaun has been set up are confirmed by a vital piece of evidence. However, the truth they both uncover places their lives in great danger
S01E05

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc:
Correction: The mysterious Jessica Mallory arrives in London as the most closely guarded secrets of the intelligence services face exposure. Rachel faces a terrible choice that will not only decide Shaun's fate but also have an impact on the nation's entire criminal justice system. Famke Janssen (X-Men) guest stars in the conclusion of the crime drama
S01E06

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Ho Chi Minh City to Phan Thiet: Michael Portillo travels from Ho Chi Minh City to Halong Bay, and uncovers the traumatic 20th-century history of Vietnam, a country that went from a French colony to a socialist republic. Along the way, he braves the city streets on a motorcycle, samples French-Vietnamese fusion food, and tries his hand at the national sport
S01E07

programme.title: Canals: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc:
Engineering: Liz McIvor tells the story of the early canal builders who struggled with the rugged terrain of England's Pennine hills. Creating a network of canals in this landscape was an major challenge, but connecting the powerhouses of Yorkshire and Lancashire was a great incentive at the time of the Industrial Revolution. Liz considers the strategic considerations and implications of this massive engineering project
S01E01

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc:
Visiting Rocky: Lionel becomes depressed that his abilities are dwindling as he ages, while Jean meets his active, outgoing and eccentric father Rocky for the first time - and finds him surprisingly endearing. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer
S02E03

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads?
programme.desc:
Home Is the Hero: Terry arrives home to find his parents on holiday, the fridge empty, the house cold and Thelma her usual unhelpful self. Luckily Bob is on hand with a suggestion. Comedy, starring James Bolam and Rodney Bewes, with Brigit Forsyth
S01E02

programme.title: A History of Britain by Simon Schama
programme.desc:
The Empire of Good Intentions: Simon Schama investigates how the noble ideals behind the British Empire failed to match the reality. While British society believed it was delivering the benefits of modern Western civilisation, in truth the inhabitants of India and Ireland suffered privation due to a laissez-faire economic policy. Mutiny, famine and lack of religious sensitivity drove a wedge between Britons and Indians, while the great potato famines of the 1840s caused mass migration from Ireland to America, Canada, Australia and New Zealand
S01E14

programme.title: The Secret Life of Waves
programme.desc: David Malone investigates the importance of ocean waves. He discovers they are not made of water, can travel sideways and their sound is created by bubbles, and examines the connection between the life cycles of waves and human beings

programme.title: Restoring the Earth: The Age of Nature
programme.desc:
Changing: The documentary considers how people's understanding of nature is increasing in order to manage global warming, which is changing the planet faster than ever before
S01E03

programme.title: Return to Pembrokeshire Farm
programme.desc:
Having restored the main farmhouse, Griff Rhys Jones embarks on the second phase of his Pembrokeshire project, turning his attention to the watermill and the derelict miller's cottage. With his son George, who is training to be an architect, overseeing the design, Griff plans to convert both these outbuildings into accommodation
S02E01

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc:
Horizon: The Power of the Placebo: As they contain no active ingredient, placebo medicines and pills should not really work, but they are now being shown to be effective in helping treat pain and depression and even alleviating some of the symptoms of Parkinson's disease. This programme explores why they work and how everyone could benefit from them
S50E08

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Ho Chi Minh City to Phan Thiet: Michael Portillo travels from Ho Chi Minh City to Halong Bay, and uncovers the traumatic 20th-century history of Vietnam, a country that went from a French colony to a socialist republic. Along the way, he braves the city streets on a motorcycle, samples French-Vietnamese fusion food, and tries his hand at the national sport
S01E07

programme.title: Canals: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc:
Engineering: Liz McIvor tells the story of the early canal builders who struggled with the rugged terrain of England's Pennine hills. Creating a network of canals in this landscape was an major challenge, but connecting the powerhouses of Yorkshire and Lancashire was a great incentive at the time of the Industrial Revolution. Liz considers the strategic considerations and implications of this massive engineering project
S01E01

programme.title: A History of Britain by Simon Schama
programme.desc:
The Empire of Good Intentions: Simon Schama investigates how the noble ideals behind the British Empire failed to match the reality. While British society believed it was delivering the benefits of modern Western civilisation, in truth the inhabitants of India and Ireland suffered privation due to a laissez-faire economic policy. Mutiny, famine and lack of religious sensitivity drove a wedge between Britons and Indians, while the great potato famines of the 1840s caused mass migration from Ireland to America, Canada, Australia and New Zealand
S01E14

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Da Nang to Hoi An: Michael Portillo travels around South-east Asia, guided by his 1913 Bradshaw's Handbook on a 2,500-mile railway adventure across six countries. In the Annamite Mountains west of Da Nang, Michael joins modern Vietnamese on holiday in a quirky facsimile of a medieval French village. Later, in the tailoring capital of Hoi An, Michael sees how Cham weavers make their distinctive brocade
S01E08

programme.title: Canals: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc:
Capitalism: Liz McIvor recounts the story of 'canal mania' - a boom period of frenzied activity that helped develop Britain's modern financial economy, now centred in London. The new canal capitalists made money by investing and speculating in waterways used to carry fuel and goods around the country. However, not all canals were profitable and investors soon discovered that such a venture created losers as well as winners
S01E03

programme.title: Chris Packham's Animal Einsteins
programme.desc:
Con Artists: The naturalist looks at deception, theft and cheating in the natural world, revealing which species are the leading fraudsters and how they fool others into getting what they want. Chris shows how sea otters kidnap pups and hold them to ransom for food, while white-winged choughs pressgang youngsters from another family into their own so they get extra help to feed their chicks
S01E05

programme.title: Own the Sky: Jet Pack Dreamers
programme.desc: The story of Australian David Mayman, whose passion for the tantalising possibilities of jetpacks became an obsession. Filmed over 10 years, the documentary follows his seemingly impossible quest to realise his childhood dream to build and fly the world's first jetpack - an ambition that almost cost him his life

programme.title: Elizabeth R
programme.desc:
The Enterprise of England: King Philip is eager to avenge the execution of Mary, Queen of Scots, and urges an unprepared fleet to sail on England. Elizabeth pins her hopes on peace talks with Spain but Drake's actions in Cadiz force her hand. Historical drama, starring Glenda Jackson, Peter Jeffrey and John Woodvine
S01E05

programme.title: Elizabeth R
programme.desc:
Sweet England's Pride: The year is 1600 and Elizabeth is now an old woman yet she is still a match for the young, handsome and dashing Earl of Essex. However, problems in Ireland and crushing the rebellious Essex rob an aged and weary Queen of the will to live. Glenda Jackson and Robin Ellis star
S01E06

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Da Nang to Hoi An: Michael Portillo travels around South-east Asia, guided by his 1913 Bradshaw's Handbook on a 2,500-mile railway adventure across six countries. S01E03

programme.title: Imagine
programme.desc: Alan Yentob follows artist Sonia Boyce as she represents Great Britain at the 2022 Venice Biennale, making her the first black woman to hold this prestigious role. Cameras follows the installation of her pavilion, which draws on the lives of black women in the British music industry. The programme looks back on her career, which has encompassed pastel self-portraits, interactive ice sculptures and performance art created through improvisation

programme.title: Chris Packham's Animal Einsteins
programme.desc:

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Hue to Ninh Binh: Michael Portillo tours the imperial city of Hue, crosses the former demilitarized zone, which once separated North from South Vietnam, and takes a boat ride on the Red River Delta
S01E09

programme.title: The Joy of Winning
programme.desc: A witty, mind-expanding guide in which Hannah Fry unlocks the essential strategies a person needs to get what they want - to win more of the time. The mathematician also hails 20th-century scientists John von Neumann and John Nash, who worked out the science of success and reveals how the same rules apply to the world's biggest problems - whether its avoiding nuclear annihilation or tackling climate change

programme.title: Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid (1969)
programme.desc: Two notorious outlaws' routine of bank and train robberies is cut short when a seemingly unstoppable posse is formed to catch them. The pair plan to flee America and start a new life in Bolivia, with the Sundance Kid's schoolmistress lover in tow - but staying ahead of the law is not so easy. Western, starring Paul Newman, Robert Redford and Katharine Ross

programme.title: Blazing Saddles (1974)
programme.desc: A crooked railway tycoon whose men are terrorising a frontier town arranges for a black sheriff to be appointed, hoping the racist residents will reject him. The lawman proves more cunning than expected, and with the help of a drunken gunslinger, runs rings around the businessman. Mel Brooks' Western spoof, in which he co-stars alongside Cleavon Little, Gene Wilder and Madeline Kahn

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Hue to Ninh Binh: Michael Portillo tours the imperial city of Hue, crosses the former demilitarized zone, which once separated North from South Vietnam, and takes a boat ride on the Red River Delta

programme.title: Francesco's Italy: Top to Toe
programme.desc:
The Heart of Italy: Francesco da Mosto visits Rome, the hilltop town of Tivoli and Naples, where he explores the city's subterranean tunnels and dodges its notoriously dangerous local motorists. He also stops off at the Galleria Borghese, and the water gardens at Villa d'Este, before meeting a family whose members live near the steaming sulphur jets of Solfatara
S01E03

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 07/07/1994: Mark Goodier introduces the chart show from July 7, 1994, featuring music by Gun, Two Cowboys, the B-52's, Aswad, Elton John, the Pretenders, All-4-One, Take That, Wet Wet Wet and Abigail

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 14/07/1994: Videos and studio performances from July 1994 by Killing Joke, Blackgirl, Mariah Carey, China Black, House of Pain, the Three Tenors, Let Loose, Julian Cope, Wet Wet Wet and the Rolling Stones. Presented by Simon Mayo

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 16/04/1987: Janice Long and Peter Powell introduce the April 16 edition, with performances by Fine Young Cannibals, David Bowie, Living in a Box, Herb Alpert, Kim Wilde and Junior, Five Star, Bon Jovi, Rikki, Ferry Aid and Madonna

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 13/04/1978: Tony Blackburn presents an edition from April 13, 1978, with music by Alan Price, Dee D Jackson, Gene Farrow, Raffaella Carra, Child, Bonnie Tyler, Johnny Mathis and Deniece Williams, Genesis, Dr Hook and Brian and Michael

programme.title: John Denver: Country Boy
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the private life and public legacy of singer-songwriter John Denver, America's original 'country boy', who died in 1997. The programme features the accounts of those closest to him, revealing the man behind the music

programme.title: An Evening with Glen Campbell
programme.desc: An archive concert by country music singer Glen Campbell in which he is accompanied by 80 musicians who played original arrangements of his greatest songs. Performed at London's Royal Festival Hall in 1977

programme.title: Kenny Rogers: All in for the Gambler - A Farewell Concert Celebration
programme.desc: A star-studded 2017 concert honouring the country music superstar Kenny Rogers. Chris Stapleton, Idina Menzel, Lady A, Lionel Richie, Little Big Town are among those singing some of Rogers' greatest hits at the Bridgestone Arena in Nashville, before the country music superstar take the stage himself alongside friend and longtime duet partner Dolly Parton

programme.title: Later... with Jools Holland
programme.desc: Jools takes a look back at some of the stars of the country scene who have performed on the show over the years. The line-up includes Johnny Cash from 1994, a duet between Emmylou Harris and Steve Earle, and Willie Nelson. The programme also features some of the new stars of country, including Taylor Swift's 2009 debut on the show, as well as Kacey Musgraves and Maren Morris

programme.title: Country Kings at the BBC
programme.desc: A chronological compilation of performances from the BBC archive by male country singers, ranging from the Everly Brothers and Jerry Lee Lewis to Garth Brooks and Willie Nelson. Featuring classic songs from studio shows by Glen Campbell, Charley Pride, George Hamilton IV, Kenny Rogers, Clint Black, Johnny Cash and Eric Church

programme.title: Top of the Pops

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of the evening session on day one at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring more first-round action, with reigning champion Ronnie O'Sullivan set to conclude his match and Ali Carter beginning his. O'Sullivan got his tournament under way 12 months ago with a 10-5 victory over David Gilbert and went on to prevail 19-13 over Judd Trump in the final to become the oldest world champion in the sport's history at the age of 46 years and 148 days

programme.title: Lost: Those Who Kill
programme.desc:
The police hunt for Bjorn is intensified. Following a search of Pelle's home, Frederik and Louise uncover truths about Bjorn's past and a decision is reached on the forced removal of Maria's child. In Danish
S01E03

programme.title: Lost: Those Who Kill
programme.desc:
Another crime is committed and Frederik is convinced Bjorn is the perpetrator, but Louise's investigations point to a different suspect. Louise learns a secret that might close the case. In Danish
S01E04

programme.title: Ripping Yarns
programme.desc:
Tomkinson's Schooldays: Parodies of pre-war tales of heroism and derring-do, written by and starring Michael Palin and Terry Jones. A pupil at a public school is downtrodden one moment and official bully-in-residence the next, enjoying bizarre privileges including opium-smoking and the amorous attentions of Filipino women. From 1976
S01E01

programme.title: Ripping Yarns
programme.desc:
The Testing of Eric Olthwaite: The tragic tale of Eric Olthwaite, the world's most boring man, who unexpectedly turns his life around by joining forces with a hardened criminal and embarking on a wild life of villainy and intrigue. Comedy, written by star Michael Palin alongside Terry Jones, with Liz Smith and Kenneth Colley. From 1977
S01E02

programme.title: The Classical Collection
programme.desc:
JS Bach: The Classical Collection: A selection of performances of the music of Bach from the BBC archives featuring soloists including David Oistrakh, Yo-Yo Ma, Andras Schiff and Myra Hess
S01E01

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of the evening session on day two at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the conclusion of Ali Carter and Luca Brecel's respective first-round matches against qualifiers. Carter is a two-time runner-up, but has not gone beyond this stage since 2019 and failed to qualify for the main draw last year, while Brecel was defeated by Noppon Saengkham at this stage of the 2022 tournament

programme.title: BBC Proms
programme.desc: John Eliot Gardiner conducts the Monteverdi Choir and the English Baroque Soloists in a performance of Johann Sebastian Bach's celebrated composition St John Passion, from 2008, with Mark Padmore as the Evangelist and Peter Harvey as Christus. Petroc Trelawny presents

programme.title: Mozart Requiem and Mass in C Minor
programme.desc: Performance of the classical pieces from El Palau de la Musica in Barcelona, first broadcast more than 10 years ago to mark the anniversary of Mozart's death. John Eliot Gardiner conducts stars, including Barbara Bonney, Anne-Sofie Von Otter and Alastair Miles, who are accompanied by the Monteverdi Choir and the English Baroque Soloists

programme.title: The Art Mysteries with Waldemar Januszczak
programme.desc:
Gauguin's Vision After the Sermon: Waldemar Januszczak examines Gauguin's Vision After the Sermon,an epic 17th-century religious painting exploring temptation and desire. He uncovers some unusual connections with sumo wrestling, Victor Hugo's Les Miserables, and a 17-year-old girl called Madeleine
S01E03

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: Vitamin Pills: Miracle or Myth?: The vitamin industry is worth more than 400million a year in the UK alone, but what are these pills actually doing for people's health? Dr Giles Yeo aims to find out, exploring if vitamin and mineral supplements are what they appear to be and putting people's diets to the test to find out if they really need these supplements. Those he meets include a scientist in Copenhagen, whose groundbreaking research into antioxidants indicates they may not have the extraordinary health-enhancing properties that people believe, and a nutrition scientist from the University of Greenwich, who tells Giles that on average most people in the UK are meeting their vitamin requirements thorough their diet

programme.title: Mozart Requiem and Mass in C Minor
programme.desc: Performance of the classical pieces from El Palau de la Musica in Barcelona, first broadcast more than 10 years ago to mark the anniversary of Mozart's death. John Eliot Gardiner conducts stars, including Barbara Bonney, Anne-Sofie Von Otter and Alastair Miles, who are accompanied by the Monteverdi Choir and the English Baroque Soloists

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of the evening session on day three at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the start of Robert Milkins' first-round match against a qualifier and the conclusion of Mark Allen's contest. Allen set up a plum tie against eventual champion Ronnie O'Sullivan at this stage last year with a 10-6 victory over Scott Donaldson, and will hope to progress further this time around having won the Northern Ireland Open, UK Championship and World Grand Prix since then

programme.title: Treasures of the Anglo-Saxons
programme.desc: Historian Dr Janina Ramirez investigates the development of Anglo-Saxon art. Examining the Sutton Hoo treasures the Franks Casket, the Staffordshire Hoard and the Lindisfarne Gospels, she uncovers the secret codes and symbols that reveal the pagan past and Christian future of the Anglo-Saxon people, and discusses how their artistic development was brought to an end by the Norman invasion of 1066

programme.title: Endgame in Ireland
programme.desc:
Ceasefire: Former US president Bill Clinton talks for the first time about his decision to go against the advice of his State Department and grant Gerry Adams a visa, a move which kick-started the peace process. However, the Docklands bombing in 1996 _ followed by the explosion in Manchester four months later _ signalled the end of the ceasefire and saw Sinn Fein banned from the all-party talks
S01E03

programme.title: Return to Pembrokeshire Farm
programme.desc:
Work on the derelict miller's cottage appears to be progressing, but Griff Rhys Jones meets opposition from the locals over his plans to renovate the mill. Plus, the comedian takes on another unusual restoration project
S02E02

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc:
Horizon: 10 Things You Need to Know About the Future: Mathematician Hannah Fry is joined by a selection of BBC science experts to investigate the British public's questions about the future, trying to discover whether people could live for ever and if there will be a cure for cancer. Hannah examines the future of transport and if it will be possible to ditch fossil fuels, looks at what the weather will be like and discovers if the planet is on the verge of another mass extinction
S2017E09

programme.title: BBC Proms

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Windsor 1/5: In Windsor, Berkshire, the first to host is estate agent Vikki who's hoping to bag the 1000 prize by hosting a ladies day-themed dinner party. The guests she's hoping to impress are entrepreneur and self-proclaimed winner Mohinder, local radio DJ Mary, 66-year-old football-loving Angie and second-hand car dealer Robert. With some gamey golfers, difficult diners and cutting commentary, it promises to be a night her guests won't forget in a hurry

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Windsor 2/5: It is the second night in Windsor, and radio DJ Mary hosts an evening featuring traditional Irish dishes like vegetable soup, steak with champ, and an Eton Mess with a twist

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Windsor 3/5: The third host of the week in Windsor is outspoken entrepreneur Mohinder, who hopes to impress his fellow guests with an ambitious menu featuring tulips and a cauliflower foam

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Windsor 4/5: Day four in Windsor is hosted by retired sales manager Angie, who is planning some 1960s fun. However, her guests are not impressed by the rules she lays down at the beginning

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Brighton 5/5: In Brighton, the final day of the competition sees social worker Ruth try to impress her guests with her Jewish-Irish fusion menu. There's chaos in the kitchen before the guests even arrive, then after a mixed-up main and some unexpected veggies, Ruth's secret family cheesecake has her guests guessing if it lives up to the bill.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2022: Costa Blanca: Lee Juggurnauth helps West Midlands couple Lynn and Barry find a home on Spain's northern Costa Blanca, where they plan to permanently relocate along with their two cats Bob and Marley. Property expert Lee shows the pair the best of what their 180,000 budget can secure

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2018: Costa del Sol: Ian Steadman and Maria Callaghan want to buy their first property together in Estepona, their favourite location on Spain's Costa del Sol. Jasmine Harman searches every nook and cranny of the local market seeking a suitable property for 150,000 or less

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc:
A Liverpool family face a difficult decision choosing which one of a litter of 10 German shepherd puppies to take home with them. The Woodgreen staff also hope a Staffordshire bull terrier, brought in by social services after an incident in its previous home, will be able to find a more understanding owner, and a Yorkshire terrier with a big attitude tries to win over a couple
S01E03

programme.title: The Dog Academy
programme.desc:
Jack Russell Bertie loves to bark - and brothers Sherlock, Dobbie and Gizmo are only too eager to join the chorus. However, the incessant barking is a cause of worry for husbands Andy and Rich, so they call upon trainers Nanci and Jo to help calm this cacophonous quartet. Plus, a wife seeks help calming her 18-month-old cockapoo Freddie, as his behaviour is terrifying her husband
S01E03

programme.title: The Great Celebrity Bake Off for Stand Up to Cancer
programme.desc:
Famous faces take part in the culinary challenge, with presenters Sandi Toksvig and Noel Fielding guiding them through the assorted tasks, and Paul Hollywood and Prue Leith passing judgment on their baking skills
S06E05

programme.title: Celebrity Hunted
programme.desc:
James and Ed plot a big surprise for the hunters at Pinewood Studios and Nik and Eva hope a This Morning presenter will help them hide. Katya and Aimee do some extreme sports over in Surrey while Nikesh hides out at the home of a new associate in the Midlands. Saffron and Bobby desperately need a new plan. All in aid of Stand Up To Cancer
S05E03

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc:
I Love to Squander Promise: The comics take part in another selection of challenges, highlights of which include Jenny Eclair having a lovely time sitting on a chair while new potatoes cascade onto her head. Elsewhere, things get emotional - who can keep it together for the all-important sausage quiz? Frankie Boyle, Ivo Graham, Mae Martin and Kiell Smith-Bynoe are the other four contestants competing for Greg Davies's golden head
S15E03

programme.title: Scared of the Dark
programme.desc:
The celebrities have been living in the dark for 30 hours, and tensions are already reaching boiling point. Chris Eubank still isn't happy about the swearing in the group, prompting Chris McCausland to defend the younger members. They are shackled into pairs for 12 hours, with one pair forced to spend an extra 12 hours trapped in a two metre square box
S01E02

programme.title: Night Coppers
programme.desc:
PC Will has an unsavoury job dealing with a taxi driver angry that a passenger has been sick in his cab. However, the young officer later gets his chance to shine when he is called to an incident involving a gold-plated gun. Sergeant Andy makes an impromptu stop that leads to a drug bust and PC Jess detains someone for an assault in a strip club
S01E05

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: The team tracks down fascinating facts from around the world related to the growing British tradition of savouring takeaway food, on which a billion pounds is spent a month. Jimmy Doherty is in Thailand to discover the unexpected addition in spring rolls. He then heads to India to find out the real reason takeaway curry can be so delicious - the mythical ingredient, ghee. Amanda Byram spills the beans on coffee and learns why some cups leave consumers more 'buzzing' than others. Andi Oliver has the meaty task of learning how doner kebabs are made and bags herself an invite to the fancy award ceremony known as the Kebaftas

programme.title: The Secret World of...
programme.desc:
The Secret World of Ice Cream: Jo Brand tells the nostalgic story of how Britain fell in love with ice-cream, in an episode that peeks behind the curtain of the nation's favourite frozen treat. The heavyweights of the industry reveal the battles fought to dominate freezers, from the earliest innovations of Wall's and Lyons Maid, to the sophistication of Mars and the introduction of high-end luxury from Haagen-Dazs to Ben & Jerry's
S02E01

programme.title: Song for Marion (2012)
programme.desc: A grouchy old man has always been dismissive of his wife's role in the unconventional local choir. When she is diagnosed with a terminal illness and is no longer able to sing, he reluctantly agrees to take her place, a decision that dramatically changes his life and helps him through the hard times to come. Comedy drama, with Terence Stamp, Gemma Arterton, Vanessa Redgrave and Christopher Eccleston

programme.title: Cold Souls (2009)
programme.desc: A neurotic actor tries to cure his anxiety by undergoing a process where his soul is removed and placed in storage. While this leaves him with no fear or doubt, it also costs him his acting talent, so he tries to get the soul back, only to find it has been stolen and sold on the black market. Comic fantasy, with Paul Giamatti, David Strathairn and Emily Watson

programme.desc: A former smuggler who is on probation for transporting prescription drugs over the border from Canada to the US is trying to turn her life around, but finds herself drawn back into the drug trade to help her estranged pregnant sister to secure a safe future. Crime drama, starring Tess Thompson and Lily James

programme.title: Dancing at the Blue Iguana (2002)
programme.desc: A group of women working at a seedy Los Angeles strip club discuss their trials and triumphs, from pregnancy and abortion to the never-ending search for stardom. Downbeat drama, starring Daryl Hannah, Jennifer Tilly, Sandra Oh and Charlotte Ayanne

programme.title: Vicky Cristina Barcelona (2008)
programme.desc: Two Americans on a break in Spain encounter a seductive painter, who invites them to spend time with him at his home in Oviedo. Though the more timid of the pair is initially reluctant, her free-spirited friend persuades her to come along, resulting in a series of romantic encounters and an explosive experience with the artist's ex-wife. Woody Allen's comedy, with Scarlett Johansson, Rebecca Hall, Javier Bardem and an Oscar-winning Penelope Cruz

programme.desc: A virus sweeps across America turning people into zombies, and the government establishes measures to capture those infected and dispose of them once the process is complete. programme.title: The Score (2001)
programme.desc: A safecracker comes dangerously close to getting caught red-handed, so decides the time has come to quit his life of crime. However, an old friend soon tempts him back with the chance to steal a priceless French artefact being stored in a customs house, and he joins forces with a talented young thief to carry out one last heist. Crime thriller, starring Robert De Niro, Edward Norton, Marlon Brando and Angela Bassett

programme.desc: A poor orphan makes a deal with an enchantress - in return for beauty, a lavish life and the admiration of every man, she will never be with the one she truly loves. Chinese fantasy drama, starring Jang Dong-gun, Hiroyuki Sanada, Cecilia Cheung and Nicholas Tse

programme.title: Ghost Dog: The Way of the Samurai (1999)
programme.desc: A hitman lives by a strict code of honour inspired by ancient Japanese traditions. When his latest assignment goes wrong, the gangster he works for decides to have him killed. Thriller, with Forest Whitaker and John Tormey

programme.title: Waking Ned (1998)
programme.desc: An old man wins the lottery, then immediately drops dead of shock. Eager to get their hands on the money, two of his friends pretend he is still alive - and soon have the entire community conspiring to keep up the pretence in return for a share of the jackpot. Comedy, starring David Kelly, Ian Bannen, James Nesbitt, Fionnula Flanagan and Susan Lynch

programme.title: Ghost Writer (2007)
programme.desc: A composer takes in a penniless writer, but when he realises his kindness is being cruelly exploited, he kills his guest in a fit of rage. To make up for his crime, he arranges to have the dead author's last work posthumously published - but when he takes credit for the work, his victim's spirit returns to haunt him. Black comedy, directed by and starring Alan Cumming. With David Boreanaz and Anne Heche

programme.title: Rampart (2011)
programme.desc: A bigoted, misanthropic cop frequently breaks the law in carrying out his duty, while maintaining a complex home life with his two ex-wives. When he is caught on camera beating a suspect, the ensuing investigation brings his past offences to light, and his refusal to change threatens to tear his world apart. Crime drama, starring Woody Harrelson, Ned Beatty, Ben Foster, Cynthia Nixon and Anne Heche

programme.title: Kill Your Friends (2015)
programme.desc: A treacherous, cocaine-addicted record executive enjoys success at the height of the Britpop era, but as public tastes change, he finds himself floundering and desperate for a hit. He soon realises that the best way to stay on top is to eliminate his rivals by any means necessary. Drama based on John Niven's novel, starring Nicholas Hoult, Ed Skrein, James Corden and Rosanna Arquette

programme.title: Bushwick (2017)
programme.desc: When a US-based military force invades their Brooklyn neighbourhood, 20-year-old Lucy and war veteran Stupe must depend on each other to survive. Fast-paced action, starring Dave Bautista and Brittany Snow

programme.title: Faintheart (2008)
programme.desc: Family man Richard finds solace from his humdrum life in the world of historical battle re-enactments. However, when his hobby sees him spend more time on the battlefield than at home, his wife leaves him for a gym instructor, forcing Richard to reassess his priorities. Romantic comedy, starring Eddie Marsan, Ewen Bremner, Jessica Hynes, Bronagh Gallagher, Tim Healy and Paul Nicholls

programme.title: The Nines (2007)
programme.desc: An actor's drug-fuelled misadventures leave him under house arrest in a building he believes to be haunted, a TV writer watches his sitcom collapse around him and a man is stranded in the wilderness with a mysterious woman for company. Drama following three connected stories, starring Ryan Reynolds in multiple roles. With Melissa McCarthy and Hope Davis

programme.title: The Hummingbird Project (2018)
programme.desc: Cousins Vincent and Anton are players in the high-stakes game of high-frequency trading. They want to build a straight fibre-optic cable line between Kansas and New Jersey, making them a fortune and taking them on a daring adventure. Writer/director Kim Nguyen's drama, starring Jesse Eisenberg, Alexander Skarsgard and Salma Hayek

programme.title: Siberia (2018)
programme.desc: An American diamond merchant and his girlfriend get caught in the crossfire when a business deal goes wrong in Russia. Crime thriller, starring Keanu Reeves

programme.desc: A lawyer reluctantly agrees to accompany her boyfriend on a weekend trip to his favourite wilderness spot. Horror thriller, starring Missy Peregrym, Jeff Roop and Eric Balfour
